intro: Chonemorpha nouettiana, commonly known as the sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to low moisture conditions. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to access water from deep underground. The flowers, which are typically white or pale yellow, bloom in late spring and early summer.
